profileText: A Senator from Iowa; born in Cedar Falls, Black Hawk County, Iowa, December 23, 1928; attended the public schools; attended the University of Northern Iowa, Cedar Falls; graduated from Arizona State University, Tempe, Ariz., in 1950, and received a master's degree from the same university in 1953; paratrooper in the United States Army 1946-1947; United States Army Reserve 1948-1960; active in farming and the insurance and health care businesses; Scott County Supervisor 1962-1965; Iowa State senator 1966-1968; lieutenant governor of Iowa 1968-1972; elected as a Republican to the United States Senate, November 7, 1978, and served from January 3, 1979, to January 3, 1985; unsuccessful candidate for reelection; co-chairman, Joint Economic Committee (Ninety-eighth Congress); chairman, National Credit Union Administration; died in Bettendorf, Iowa, on November 13, 2020; interment in Memorial Park Cemetery, Davenport, Iowa.

researchRecord.name: Correspondence in Alden J. Erskine papers, 1923-1977.

1968-1984. Ca. 527 feet. Covers service as lieutenant governor of Iowa (1969-1973), unsuccessful campaign for governor (1970), and career in the Senate (1979-1985). Closed except with written permision of the senator, until his death.
Correspondence in Arthur A. Neu papers, 1965-1979; Frederick Delbert Schwengel papers, 1940-1972; and E. Kelly papers, 1965-1978. Finding aid.
